title.value: Intervertebral Disc Labeling With Learning Shape Information, A Look Once Approach
title.justification: The title clearly indicates the focus of the paper is on the learning shape information for intervertebral disc labeling using a 'Look Once' approach.
title.quote: Intervertebral Disc Labeling With Learning Shape Information, A Look Once Approach

extractions.description: The paper proposes a novel U-Net-based structure to predict intervertebral disc locations by integrating image shape information to enhance the model's learning capabilities. A permutation invariant 'look once' model is suggested to improve candidate recovery by reducing false positives. The method demonstrates superior performance on the Spine Generic public multi-center dataset.

type.justification: The paper focuses on implementing and testing a new model architecture for segmenting intervertebral discs, which indicates it is an empirical study.
type.quote: The proposed method was evaluated on the spine generic public multi-center dataset and demonstrated superior performance compared to previous work.

name.justification: The paper is about intervertebral disc segmentation within medical images, focusing on improving accuracy and reducing false positives.
name.quote: Accurate and automatic segmentation of intervertebral discs from medical images is a critical task for the assessment of spine-related diseases.

name.justification: The use of deep learning techniques, such as U-Net and permutation invariant models, is fundamental to the proposed method.
name.quote: We aim to alleviate this problem by proposing a novel U-Net-based structure to predict a set of candidates for intervertebral disc locations.

name.justification: The study involves processing and interpreting 2D and 3D visual data from MRI scans, tasks typical of computer vision applications.
name.quote: Intervertebral disc labeling using a fully convolutional redundant counting model.

name.justification: The U-Net model is specifically mentioned as part of the proposed method for intervertebral disc labeling.
name.quote: To alleviate this problem by proposing a novel U-Net-based structure to predict a set of candidates for intervertebral disc locations.

is_contributed.justification: The U-Net model is utilized in the paper but is not introduced as an original contribution.

is_executed.justification: The execution is implied as the study evaluates the method's performance on datasets.
is_executed.quote: The proposed method was evaluated on the spine generic public multi-center dataset and demonstrated superior performance compared to previous work.

is_compared.justification: The model's performance is compared with several other approaches discussed in the literature.
is_compared.quote: The proposed method was evaluated...and demonstrated superior performance compared to previous work.

referenced_paper_title.value: U-Net: Convolutional Networks for Biomedical Image Segmentation
referenced_paper_title.justification: U-Net is a well-known architecture in image segmentation tasks, typically referenced for its original contributions to the field.

name.justification: PointNet is adapted and used in the study for refining predictions and reducing false positives.
name.quote: a modified version of the PointNet model which is invariant to certain geometric transformations

is_contributed.justification: PointNet is an existing model referenced in the paper for its application to the proposed task.
is_contributed.quote: a modified version of the PointNet model

is_executed.justification: The execution is implied as the study utilizes the model to reduce false positives and refine predictions.
is_executed.quote: In the second stage, we propose a deep permutation invariant 'look once' model to refine the prediction results and eliminate the FP candidates.

is_compared.justification: The focus of the comparison was more on the overall proposed method rather than individual models used within it, such as PointNet.
is_compared.quote: To the best of our knowledge, this is the first post-processing algorithm that processes the whole prediction in one step without any iteration ('look once').

referenced_paper_title.value: PointNet: Deep Learning on Point Sets for 3D Classification and Segmentation
referenced_paper_title.justification: PointNet is specifically referenced in the paper for its innovative approach to point cloud data processing.
referenced_paper_title.quote: modified version of the PointNet model [22] which is invariant to certain geometric transformations

name.justification: The dataset is identified by name as the source of data for evaluating the proposed method.
name.quote: Our analysis was based on the publicly available Spine Generic Dataset [16].

referenced_paper_title.value: Open-access quantitative MRI data of the spinal cord and reproducibility across participants, sites and manufacturers. sci. data.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The Spine Generic Dataset's reference supports the dataset's role in enabling reproducibility and standardization across studies involving spinal cord images.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Our analysis was based on the publicly available Spine Generic Dataset [16].
